headline: China delays approval of $35 billion merger between Synopsys and Ansys, FT reports
summary: The U.S. and China reached a tentative trade truce at talks in London this week after a previous agreement faltered over China's curbs on mineral exports.  That prompted the Trump administration to apply additional export controls on shipments of semiconductor design software, jet engines for Chinese-made planes and other goods.
